text: <@U0MM86C84>: I don’t believe so <@U11MANG9G> might know better
<@U0MM86C84>: Nope. Usually certificates are kind of 'final' after issuance...
Is there a use-case that you are trying to address?
It might be easier to request a cert with a new list of attr (unless you are trying to reuse the 'attestation')
why have we vendored empty.pb.go and timestamp.pb.go from google/protobuf which is no longer a thing?
this makes it impossible to build chaincode outside the vagrant environment
Hi <@U11MANG9G>: If for instance a new user registers and enrolls, the only way to assign this user certain attributes (company: ibm etc.) is to manually input them into the membrsrvc file?
(I monitor it much more closely, there are others there, etc...)
But the quick answer is that we should add a gRPC call that does it dynamically
